round_1: ^Yes! Woof! For I am a dog.
^My name is Squ...og. Squog. Bark bark woof.

c-0: ^You might be the smallest dog I've ever seen!
g-0: ^Iron deficiency. It'll do that to ya.
^If you see any cats, you gotta warn me immediately, capiche?

c-2: ^You don't even know the half of it. Hopefully you never will!
c-3: ^Haven't you got it the wrong way round? Cats usually chase rodents, not dogs...
^Exactly! I mean- No... Just- Never mind!

round_2: ^Oh! You! Uh, bark! Woof! Et cetera!

g-0: ^Don't worry your pretty little head about it!
^Do you know where to get some acorns?

c-1: ^They're probably on the ground here somewhere!
c-2: ^They come from certain kinds of trees, right?
^So you don't know which ones? I'm kinda struggling here.
c-3: ^They come from oak trees. I can't imagine they'll be very tasty for a dog, though.
^You'd be surprised! Don't knock 'em till you try 'em, I say. Oh, woof, by the way.

round_3: ^Woof and bark and all that jazz.

c-0: ^Ah, we humans don't do that. We're always up and about, except at night when we sleep.
g-0: ^Gives you plenty of energy for the entire rest of the year!
^Although having said that... Maybe overly energetic humans for half the year isn't such a good idea.

c-1: ^We've evolved this way for a reason! Regardless of my opinion, it's now nature wants us to be.
^But it's a fun thought experiment, no?
c-2: ^That means plenty of energy for play! Wouldn't you like that?
^NO! Wait, yes? What do dogs like?
c-3: ^I don't need the extra energy. I'm happy as I am right now!
^That's probably for the best. I just thought about you picking me up. No offense - I like to climb trees, not humans. Dogs can climb trees, right?
